perturbation.original_text:
"Authorized Third Parties" means Drax Group Plc. and Alberta Innovates Corporation, and, subject to FCE obtaining the prior written consent of ExxonMobil, which consent will not be unreasonably withheld, conditioned, or delayed, the respective successors, assigns, joint venturers, partners and contractors of each of them.

"Authorized Work" means non-commercial activities restricted to research and development, pilot plant, deployment, and demonstration projects, and commercial activities for which FCE has obtained the prior written consent of ExxonMobil.
perturbation.changed_text:
"Authorized Third Parties" means Drax Group Plc. and Alberta Innovates Corporation, and the respective successors, assigns, joint venturers, partners and contractors of each of them.

"Authorized Work" means activities restricted to research and development, pilot plant, deployment, and demonstration projects, and commercial activities .
perturbation.explanation: The original definition of Authorized Third Parties and Authorized Work requires FCE to obtain prior written consent from ExxonMobil for certain activities and for the successors, assigns, joint venturers, partners and contractors of each of them. The modified version removes the requirement for ExxonMobil's consent. If another section refers back to these definitions assuming ExxonMobil's approval is needed, this contradiction would create uncertainty.

perturbation.original_text:
20.04 Future Work. This Agreement shall not constitute or imply any promise or intention: (a) to enter into any other agreement of any nature, (b) to make any purchase of products or services by either Party or its Affiliates, or (c) to make any commitment by either Party, its Affiliates, or licensees with respect to present or future marketing or supply of any product or service.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, prior to the end of the Term of this Agreement and subject to FCE achieving Milestone 1 and Milestone 2 to ExxonMobil's satisfaction, the Parties agree to negotiate in good faith commercially reasonable terms for the demonstration of Generation 2 Technology at one or more of ExxonMobil's commercial facilities.
perturbation.changed_text:
20.04 Future Work. This Agreement shall not constitute or imply any promise or intention: (a) to enter into any other agreement of any nature, (b) to make any purchase of products or services by either Party or its Affiliates, or (c) to make any commitment by either Party, its Affiliates, or licensees with respect to present or future marketing or supply of any product or service.

Notwithstanding the foregoing, prior to the end of the Term of this Agreement and subject to FCE achieving Milestone 1, the Parties agree to negotiate in good faith commercially reasonable terms for the demonstration of Generation 2 Technology at one of ExxonMobil's commercial facilities.
perturbation.explanation: The original version requires that 'subject to FCE achieving Milestone 1 and Milestone 2 to ExxonMobil's satisfaction'. While the modified version requires only 'Milestone 1' being achieved for negotiation. This contradiction would create uncertainty as to whether both or one milestone is a condition.

perturbation.original_text: 9.03 Settlements. Each Party may resolve any risk or threat, or settle any suits or action related to use of any Program Results, without the prior approval of the other Party unless such resolution or settlement would cause the other Party to be: (a) obligated to make any payment or part with any tangible or intangible property right, or (b) obligated to assume any obligations with respect thereto, or (c) subject to any injunction.
perturbation.changed_text: 9.03 Settlements. Each Party may resolve any risk or threat, or settle any suits or action related to use of any Program Results, after notifying the other Party. In cases where the settlement involves financial obligations for the other party, prior approval is required.
perturbation.explanation: The original version states that each party may resolve any risk, threat, or settle any suits without the other party's prior approval unless it causes the other party to face obligations, while the changed version states that settlements can be resolved after notifying the other party, creating ambiguity.
perturbation.location: ARTICLE 9 - INFRINGEMENT OF THIRD PARTY PATENTS
